title: Tour of Britain Women to be broadcast live on the BBC
content:
Cyclist
Tour of Britain Women to be broadcast live on the BBC

The Tour of Britain Women, scheduled to run from 5-8th June 2025, will be broadcast live on BBC Sport. The four-stage race from Tees Valley to Glasgow will be free to watch on BBC iPlayer and the BBC Sport website and app. Content will also be on the BBC Sport social media channels.

The coverage comes as part of the BBC’s ‘women’s summer of sport’, joining a host of sports including football, tennis and athletics that will be broadcast live on the BBC’s channels.

There will be a record 19 teams competing in the Tour of Britain Women this season, including SD Worx-Protime with European champion Lorena Wiebes and EF Education-Oatly with Olympic gold medallist Kristen Faulkner. Former winner Lizzie Deignan will also be riding her last Tour of Britain before retirement at the end of the season, while it will be the first appearance for rising star Cat Ferguson.

Managing director of British Cycling Events, Jonathan Day, said, ‘The event is breaking records this year with the number of teams riding across the four stages, so it is brilliant news that the races will be available across BBC Sport’s platforms, allowing the British public to follow the action from this sporting spectacle.’

British Cycling is additionally launching a dedicated Lloyds Tour of Britain TikTok channel to target a younger audience.

The Tour of Britain Women will kick off in Dalby Forest on Thursday 5th June and will visit Saltburn-by-the-Sea and the Scottish Borders before the final stage in Glasgow on 8th June.

The 2024 edition was won by Lotte Kopecky, 17sec ahead of Great Britain’s Anna Henderson with Kopecky’s SD Worx teammate Christine Majerus completing the podium.
